name: Cathie Wood
tweet: In a research collaboration with $SQ, @yassineARK, @wintonARK, and @skorusARK debunk the myth that #Bitcoin mining is damaging the environment. Instead, as crypto mining, energy storage, and AI technologies converge, the adoption of renewable energy is likely to accelerate!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Love to see those metrics if you can find them!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The source for the ratio of the US equity market cap to GDP is  https://t.co/DOdGRcqvug, a website dedicated to the Buffet indicator. @ARKInvest will research this metric pre-WWII to assess its validity.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: “This time is different” are dangerous words in forecasting markets. Most forecasters use post World War II history as their guide. On that basis, never has the equity market been higher relative to GDP. In the late 1800’s, however, it seems to have been 2-3 times higher.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Deflation should lower the velocity of money, a mirror image of the seventies. If consumers and businesses expect prices to fall, many will defer spending. As a result, the rapid growth in global money is unlikely to unleash generalized inflation, except perhaps in asset prices.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Bad Deflation: “Creative destruction” could compound the deflation. Since the tech and telecom bust, many companies have catered to short-term oriented shareholders, leveraging balance sheets to repurchase shares and pay dividends while neglecting to invest enough in innovation.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Good Deflation: The deflationary forces associated with the five major platforms evolving today could be much more powerful than those caused by telephone, electricity, and the automobile.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The technologically-enabled innovation evolving today dwarfs that of the late 1800s/early 1900s: genomic sequencing, robotics, energy storage, artificial intelligence, and blockchain technology. Moreover, Bitcoin could be today’s “gold standard”, increasing purchasing power!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: As deflation pressured an increasingly difficult-to-measure nominal GDP (the denominator), exponential unit growth and rapid productivity gains increased the quality of earnings while low interest rates boosted their capitalization (the numerator).

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Telephone, electricity, and the automobile were the three major technology-enabled platforms during the 50 years that ended in the Roaring Twenties. Technology-enabled platforms are deflationary thanks to learning curves, or Wright’s Law. The Gold Standard also was in force.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: In the late 1800’s and early 1900’s - as telephone, electricity, and the automobile were emerging - the US equity market cap relative to GDP appears to have been 2-3 times higher than it is today. We need to verify this difficult-to-get data but, if true, I have a hypothesis.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Investors need to get and stay on the right side of change.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Companies that did not innovate and instead leveraged up to buy back stock and distribute dividends to satisfy short-term oriented shareholders, including private equity, will pay a steep price. They will have to cut prices to move aging inventory and service debt. Bad deflation.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: One more thought: @ARKInvest believes that the massive amount of disruptive innovation and good deflation evolving today is causing creative destruction and bad deflation elsewhere.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: After gestating for 20-30 years, the dream has turned into reality, but given the reactions to @ARKInvest’s research, many investors seem skeptical or reticent. This wall of worry is healthy: I would prefer to invest in the face of fear than exuberance!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The seeds for the explosion in innovation today were planted during the tech and telecom bubble in the late nineties. Back then, investors chased the dream before the tech was ready and while costs were too high.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: If deflation limits the long term Treasury yield to low single digits, the discount factor used to present value future cash flows probably will fall to surprisingly low levels during the next few years, a massive head fake in the face of higher inflation expectations.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The technologically enabled innovation evolving today is dwarfing that during any other period in history. It is creating “good deflation” and explosive demand. Battery technology is a good example. In @ARKInvest’s view, EVs will scale 15-20 fold in the next five years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: GDP statistics evolved during the Industrial Age and do not seem to be keeping up with the digital age. Thanks to productivity, real GDP growth probably is higher and inflation lower than reported, suggesting that the quality of earnings has increased significantly.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Thank you, @wintonARK, for leading our exceptional analysts! You are one of the cornerstones of @ARKInvest’s success.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: This study seems to suggest that most auto manufacturers will lose money in the electric vehicle space if they try and compete with $TSLA on technology (range, performance, etc.) AND price. I wonder if their brands, born in the ICE age, will help them overcome their challenges.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Looking forward to learning more about #AI, cybersecurity, and much more from @summerlinARK next Wednesday!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: .@summerlinARK has hit the ground running at @ARKInvest! I’ve learned so much from him already.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Excited for this conversation!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Human error accounts for ~85% of of auto accidents and fatalities. We believe that data will convince regulators that human-driven vehicles are weapons of mass destruction. They cause 35-40,000 deaths per year in the US and more than 1.25 millions deaths globally.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Ed Hyman, a well-respected economist, concocted this back of the envelope calculation to illustrate a point. Why did the PE of the S&P 500 top out regularly at 20-25X as the 10-year Treasury bond yield declined from 6% to 0.5%?

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Oh yes, I forgot to mention how scarce exponential growth opportunities are likely to become as #artificialintelligence creates more winner-take-most opportunities like autonomous taxi networks!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The PE on the S&P 500 is likely to adjust to 2-3% nominal GDP growth as disruptive innovation creates “creative destruction” in the traditional world order. If 10-year Treasury yields were to settle in the 2-3% range, the S&P 500’s PE would adjust accordingly: 1/.03=33.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The equity market does not seem ever to have discounted 0.5%, 1%, 2%, or 3% yields on the 10 year Treasury bond. The PE on the S&P 500 has topped out at 20-25X regularly since the tech and telecom bust, even as 10-year Treasury yields have declined from 6%.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Based on deeper research into Tesla’s #battery technology, its #AI breakthroughs, and its #ride-hailing possibilities, @TashaARK has pulled together and updated our $TSLA model with great input from @skorusARK and guidance from @wintonARK. Thank you for your tireless research!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Making choices.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Today, @QuincyDJones is celebrating his 88th birthday on the 64th anniversary of the Grammys. Wow! Everyone should take inspiration from Quincy at the lucky age of 88 as he prepares to take the industry to a new level.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: In an upcoming podcast with music legend @QuincyDJones, we will address his incredible impact on the industry to date and the next exciting chapter he has planned to take music and artists to new heights.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: According to ARK’s research, music streaming revenue in the US could grow at an annual rate of 15%, from roughly $10 billion last year to $20 billion in 2025. As we celebrate the Grammys tonight, I’d love to learn what others see in the future for artists and their music.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Thanks to streaming and bundling, the music industry recently surpassed the $24 billion peak hit more than 20 years ago in 1999. Tonight the #GRAMMYs will give the industry more cause for celebration, especially now that new platforms are evolving to reward all artists!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Companies involved in the #genomics revolution do not seem to be betting on heredity as a significant cause of disease? Curious.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Companies disrupting the traditional world order - like $TSLA and $SQ - are wise to hedge their fiat reserves with $BTC. Other companies in harm’s way because of disruptive innovation should be investing their cash in new technologies to avoid creative destruction.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: I believe that Elon Musk understands this important dynamic. For goodness sake, one of his top priorities is saving the planet.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: We’ll miss you, @draecomino, but look forward to watching @labelbox  and you blaze an important trail in the #AI space!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: With many thanks to our incredible marketing team led by @s_benkert for originating and creating @ARKInvest’s small contribution to this global crisis, and to all of you who are amplifying its impact through our Swag for Good!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Having been through many crises, I have learned that waiting to contribute to a cause is sensible. Many wonderful people contribute in early days of a crisis when the response is not well organized. We hope that our contributions to those hurt by COVID-19 will serve them well.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: With gratitude to our incredible analysts @ARKInvest led by @wintonARK, our DoR, as well as our first-in-class marketing and compliance teams, I hope that you enjoy the very big ideas in Big Ideas 2021!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: As Chair of the Fed from February 2014 to February 2018, Yellen was on policy watch as bitcoin soared from ~$1,000 to ~$20,000 in 2017. The fact that this week she focused on the risk of potential nefarious actors instead of the risk to US monetary sovereignty is reassuring.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: #Square business model illustrates that vertical integration can create moats, or barriers to entry, and deliver superior financial results. $TSLA business model is doing the same thing, giving it a lead in the #EV/AV market that will be difficult for others to catch.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: @FOCUS_ON_RISK Strong brand, yes, but its take rate is likely to drop from 20-25% to 5% or less as a lead generator for autonomous taxi networks like the one that @ARKInvest believes $TSLA will dominate in the US.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: $UBER and $LYFT stayed private too long and lost the plot. They could have incentivized their drivers to put sensors on their cars and collect data much faster than even $TSLA. Autonomous is an AI project. The winners will have the most high quality data and the best AI expertise

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: As first mover, Apple still generates the bulk of profits in the smartphone space globally. In our view, Tesla could do the same in the #autonomous space, certainly in the US and perhaps elsewhere as well.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: #Tesla dropped $NVDA, not because its GPUs missed the move toward #autonomous, but because the design cycle of $GM, $BMW, & #TM was 4-5 years longer than that for Tesla. Catering to large auto manufacturers, Nvidia was not moving fast enough for Tesla.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: #Tesla took a leaf from #Apple’s business plan when it designed its own  #AI chip. Apple designed its own smartphone chip when #QCOM was catering to Motorola, Nokia, and Ericsson, none of which understood that phones could and would become smart.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Happily for $TSLA investors, @tim_cook missed the reincarnation of $AAPL when @elonmusk approached him while experiencing “production hell” with the Model3. An #EV is the ultimate mobile device.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Follow the open source developers!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The next “FANGs” are being birthed in the genomic revolution!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: In our research, which we give away as a service, we aim to surface and highlight the risks that are increasing in both growth and value benchmarks. If we are correct, exponential growth in the digital world will “Amazon” industries and sectors during the next 10 years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Make that 47 years, incredible. The rubber band continues to stretch!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The Philly Fed Index, the first October gauge of US manufacturing economic activity, showed that new orders were the strongest since 1973. New orders have not been this strong in 37 years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Erin go Bragh!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Passive investing is unlikely to keep pace with the exponential growth of the five innovation platforms and 14 technologies evolving today. In our view, S&P is depriving benchmark-sensitive investors of some of the most important investment opportunities in the world, like $TSLA.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Passive and benchmark-sensitive investing is contributing to the most massive misallocation of capital in history. Investing in companies because of their past successes risks putting the US at a serious competitive disadvantage to countries like China.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The S&P 500 and the NASDAQ are populating their benchmarks increasingly with the “value traps” created by innovation, stocks that are cheap for a reason. Innovation is disintermediating and/or disrupting the biggest companies in traditional benchmarks.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Disruptive innovation is another way of saying “creative destruction”. @ARKInvest typically researches the “Big Ideas” that will transform the way the world works. In “Bad Ideas”, we highlight the likely victims.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: We've been informed of fraudulent YouTube channels & websites posing as @ARKInvest & @CathieDWood. ARK will NEVER use YouTube, Twitter, IG or any social media to solicit money, including bitcoin. We encourage you to report any account that may impersonate ARK or our affiliates.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: @elonmusk Ah yes. Thanks for flagging. I meant the $25,000 car which some are calling the Model 2, as shown in our ARK Disrupt Weekly Newsletter this morning.  https://t.co/uh76avGNvt  https://t.co/pxqNjEz0nk

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: The auto industry has not enjoyed exponential growth in roughly 100 years. EVs have entered exponential growth territory that will last for the next five to ten years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: According to @skorusARK’s battery research, #EV sales will scale nearly 20-fold from roughly 1.8 million last year to 35 million, 40% of total global auto sales, during the next five to six years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Analysts following $TSLA should be expert in energy storage, robotics, artificial intelligence, and software-as-service. While they are expert at the internal combustion engine, traditional auto analysts are not equipped to analyze EVs, particularly $TSLA.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: According to Wright’s Law, for every cumulative doubling in the number of EVs produced, costs will drop by 28%, suggesting that EV prices will drop below those of gas powered vehicles on a like-for-like basis during the next two years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Traditional auto analysts are analyzing a mature industry in which lower prices signal trouble: higher inventories and lower sales. Led by #Tesla, electric vehicles (EVs) are in their infancy, and BECAUSE of lower costs and prices, are moving into exponential growth trajectory.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Predictably, when @elonmusk announced at Battery Day last week that $TSLA would cut the price of a Model 3 to $25,000, several financial analysts panicked, downgrading the stock and/or cutting their price targets. In our view, traditional financial analysts have missed the mark.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: As @sbarnettARK elucidates in this extensive tweet thread, $ILMN - with 85-90% share of the DNA sequencing market - is entering a crowded molecular diagnostic testing market and will be competing with its customers, a questionable strategy.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: With my apology to $GS, which was not monitoring the order book before it filled. That said, I do believe that our $GS sales trading contact, with whom we interacted many times for updates, should have explained the difference between Dutch and Unified auctions. Lessons learned.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: I stand corrected: $U did a Unified auction, not a Dutch auction, something completely new to me. With thanks both to my compliance team and to a long time professional friend, Lise Buyer, Partner at Class V Group LLC, for steering me correctly.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Didn’t $ILMN take its ownership of  #GRAIL down from 100% to 14% at a much lower valuation to avoid competing with its customers?

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: .@GrousARK has done some of the most provocative and differentiated research on #gaming in the financial services industry. We are excited to share our forthcoming blogs and white papers during the next few months.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: I am sure that $GS disclosed this twist in many documents, but it never apprised us despite discussions with its sales traders of our clear desire to gain exposure to $U. Did $GS’s highest revenue generating customers get the word? I don’t want to be in that club. Just wondering.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Apparently, $GS introduced a Dutch auction twist that did not require it to inform those who had committed to a price above the “range” that the range had changed, unless the “indicated price range” had increased by 20%+. Excuse me?

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Some of us who placed bids above the initial 40-44 indicated range, and then raised our bids above the revised 44-48 range, assuming that our bids would be filled, learned the hard way that we would receive nothing. Very few things surprise me in this business, but this one did.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Equity Dutch auctions were designed to democratize initial public offerings. In 2014, I founded @ARKInvest to help democratize investing in the innovation space. Despite best intentions, this week $U went public in a Dutch auction sponsored by $GS that we believe missed the mark.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: According to @skorusARK research, other companies focused on EVs are three to four years behind $TSLA in battery technology already. The question is whether these breakthroughs will help #Tesla pull away even faster.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Are they more fundamental breakthroughs? Would a 90%+ decline in each of the three important variables - assembly line labor costs, cell cost saving per unit of energy, and factory floor space - change the slope of the line, accelerating the decline in costs from 18%?

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Thank you for this detailed and thoughtful analysis! @ARKInvest is debating whether these advancements will keep Tesla on pace with Wright’s Law: an 18% decline in the cost of EV’s battery pack systems for every cumulative doubling in EV demand, or

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: While our terrific compliance team felt more comfortable with the question mark in “Bitcoin: A Compelling Monetary Asset?”, I believe that our crypto analyst, @yassineARK, answers the question convincingly in the report he authored in collaboration with @coinmetrics!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Part 1 of a comprehensive and thoughtful update to our “Bitcoin: Ringing the Bell for a New Asset Class”, not only a new asset class but also a new monetary system, thanks to @yassineARK’s research in collaboration with @coinmetrics.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: #GRAIL’s longitudinal study gave us the first clue that, thanks to methylation, scientists and geneticists will be able to identify #pancreatic cancer - one of the most deadly - in Stage 1. While the science causes many eyes to glaze over, @sbarnettARK will educate us over time!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Terrific podcast! Economic transformation thanks to technologically-enabled innovation. Thanks for sharing @dkimerling, @mfriedrichARK, and @GeorgeOfARK.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: #SaaS 1.0 and SaaS 2.0 are not mutually exclusive. SaaS 2.0, as in $TWLO and $WORK, is more viral: users sell the services to each other. A powerhouse at more than a $20 billion revenue run rate, $CRM needs to make large acquisitions like $DATA to maintain growth north of 20%.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Software is eating the world:$CRM is replacing $XOM in the Dow Jones Industrial Average! #Salesforce’s market cap had to scale to $200 billion before attracting the attention of this index. $CRM has been amazing, but it’s SaaS 1.0 which now is giving way to a more viral SaaS 2.0.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: .@ARKInvest has centered its research on Wright’s Law. Wright’s Law is much better than Moore’s Law in forecasting the pace of technologically enabled innovation, even in the semiconductor industry. Wright’s Law is a function of units while Moore’s Law is a function time.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: #2U is heading in the same direction, and starting to lower prices (check out its Simmons U nursing program). Yes, higher education is facing massive disruption. Many colleges will not survive but those disrupting them, or enabling others like $TWOU to disrupt them, will thrive.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: America at its best, Steve! Thank you for believing in and contributing to the American dream.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Indeed, @TashaARK @skorusARK @wintonARK!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: A great reason, @jablamsky! Technologically enabled innovation follows declining cost curves and prices that enable exponential growth opportunities for mass markets. Stay on the right side of change!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: If successful, which we believe will be the case, a $TSLA ride-hailing service will lower the probability of our bear case substantially during the next five years, bolstering our base case at ~$7,000. We are encouraged that few analysts are modeling this possibility!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Now that $TSLA has 80% and 23% share of the US and Chinese #EV markets, respectively, and has been profitable for the last 4 quarters, it is likely to join the “big leagues”, the indexes. Oh, and it is up roughly 5-fold since it troughed in March to more than $250B in market cap.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Exactly. Passive/benchmark-sensitive investors have been protecting $INTC from reality for the last ten years, buying it only because it is one of the large tech positions in benchmarks, enabling it to rest on its laurels even though Moore’s Law had hit a wall.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Putting small businesses on par with larger ones, new bankruptcy laws will accelerate creative disruption and disruptive innovation. Against all expectations in the midst of the coronavirus crisis, new business formations have surged. American ingenuity at its best!

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Transportation accounts for nearly 60% of #oil consumption.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: @jonnajarian Hi Jon - We’d love to do so! Thanks - Cathie

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Oil demand probably hit a secular peak last year and, thanks to #EVs, now is in secular “decline”. Though ARK has no formal forecast, I believe that #Oilprices are on their way back to $12, the level reached after the 1973 oil cartel crisis, or lower, now that EVs are taking off.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: .@ARKInvest believes that the oil price peaked at more than $135 per barrel in 2008 and has been hitting “lower highs” and “lower lows” as demand “growth” has disappointed expectations for the last 12 years.

name: Cathie Wood
tweet: Yes, a 10% drop in US VMT is a big deal. #Oilpricesare determined at the margin. A 1% drop in demand has a significant impact, so the impact of a 10% drop in one year is huge.
